Dailey_&_Vincent:
{{Short description|American bluegrass music group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Dailey & Vincent | image = Dailey & Vincent 2013.jpg | caption = Dailey & Vincent live in [[Cookeville, Tennessee]] on January 12, 2013 | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Bluegrass music|Bluegrass]], [[Bluegrass music#Bluegrass Gospel|Bluegrass Gospel]], [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2007-present | label = [[Rounder Records|Rounder]] | website = {{URL|http://www.daileyvincent.com}} | associated_acts = [[The Statler Brothers]], [[Rhonda Vincent]], [[Ricky Skaggs]], [[Doyle Lawson]], [[Jimmy Fortune]] | current_members = Jamie Dailey
Darrin Vincent
[[Patrick McAvinue]]
Aaron McCune
Wesley Smith
Gaven Largent
Shaun Richardson
Rocky Marvel
Buddy Hyatt | past_members = Jesse Stockman
Adam Haynes
Joe Dean
Seth Taylor
Christian Davis
BJ Cherryholmes
Jessie Baker
Jeff Parker
Josh Cobb
Bob Mummert }} '''Dailey & Vincent''' is an American [[bluegrass music]] group composed of Jamie Dailey (guitar, bass, vocals), Darrin Vincent (mandolin, guitar, bass, vocals), Aaron McCune (guitar, bass vocals), Wesley Smith (vocals), [[Patrick McAvinue]] (fiddle), Shaun Richardson (guitar, vocals), Rocky Marvel (drums), Gaven Largent (banjo), and Blaine Johnson (piano).{{Cite web|url=http://daileyandvincent.com/band/|title=Meet The Band|website=Daileyandvincent.com|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-10}} The group has released nine albums since 2007, seven of these for [[Rounder Records]], with all the albums having charted on at least one ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' albums chart. They have also won thirteen awards from the [[International Bluegrass Music Association]] and twenty-three awards from SPBGMA (The Society for the Preservation of Bluegrass Music of America). In 2011, they received a [[Grammy Award]] nomination for Best Country Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal, and won the 2011 Dove Award for Best Bluegrass Album with "Singing From The Heart"{{cite web|url=http://triangleartsandentertainment.org/event/grammy-nominated-dailey-vincent-return-to-raleigh/|title=Grammy-nominated Dailey & Vincent Return to Raleigh|work=Triangle Arts & Entertainment|access-date=9 February 2011}} In 2013, Dailey & Vincent received their second [[Grammy Award]] nomination for Best Bluegrass Album for their album "The Gospel Side Of Dailey & Vincent". ==Background== Jamie Dailey was formerly the lead vocalist and guitarist for [[Doyle Lawson & Quicksilver]] from 1999-2008. Darrin Vincent was formerly a musician with [[Ricky Skaggs]]' band [[Kentucky Thunder]], and was also part of the famous bluegrass family group The Sally Mountain Show, with his sister [[Rhonda Vincent]] of Rhonda Vincent & The Rage. The group's former banjo player, Joe Dean, left in March 2012 to pursue other musical interests and would later join Doyle Lawson & Quicksilver.{{cite web|url=http://bluegrasstoday.com/39944/joe-dean-to-quicksilver/|title=Joe Dean To Quicksilver|publisher=Bluegrass Today, 5 April 2012|access-date=8 May 2012}} Former fiddle player Jesse Stockman left the band in early August 2011 due to a wrist injury, giving way to BJ Cherryholmes who would continue that role until September 2016.{{cite web|url=https://bluegrasstoday.com/dailey-vincent-statement-on-stockmancherryholmes/|title=Dailey & Vincent Statement|publisher=Bluegrass Today|access-date=19 August 2011}} Cherryholmes joined the Christian rock singer [[Crowder (musician)|David Crowder]] and a month later Dailey & Vincent announced that Patrick McAvinue would be the band's new fiddle player.{{Cite web|url=https://bluegrasstoday.com/patrick-mcavinue-to-dailey-vincent/|title=Patrick McAvinue to Dailey & Vincent|date=2016-10-31|website=Bluegrass Today|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-10}} In April 2018, it was announced that Jessie Baker would be leaving the band due to debilitating nerve injury in his hands.{{Cite web|url=https://bluegrasstoday.com/jessie-baker-departing-dailey-vincent/|title=Jessie Baker departing Dailey & Vincent|date=2018-04-02|website=Bluegrass Today|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-10}} In May, Daily & Vincent announced that Gaven Largent would be the band's new banjo player.{{Cite web|url=https://bluegrasstoday.com/gaven-largent-to-dailey-vincent/|title=Gaven Largent to Dailey & Vincent|date=2018-05-21|website=Bluegrass Today|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-10}} Jeff Parker left in 2019 and started his own group Jeff Parker and Company. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- !
